001package imagingbook.lib.math;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.Collections;
008import java.util.Comparator;
009import java.util.List;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013
014/**
015 * Calculates eigenvalues and eigenvectors of square matrices of arbitrary size.
016 * Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order).
017 * A matrix may have complex eigenvalues but only real eigenvalues (and their
018 * associated eigenvectors) are considered.
019 * Uses class {@link EigenDecomposition} of the Apache Commons Math (3) library.
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2021/04/20
023 *
024 */
025public class EigensolverNxN implements RealEigensolver {
026
027        private final EigenDecomposition ed;
028        private final double[] eVals;
029        private final int[] permutation;
030
031        public EigensolverNxN(double[][] M) {
032                if (!Matrix.isSquare(M)) {
033                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix M must be square");
034                }
035                this.ed = new EigenDecomposition(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(M));
036                this.eVals = new double[M.length];
037                this.permutation = sortEigenvalues(ed.getRealEigenvalues(), ed.getImagEigenvalues());
038                //print();
039        }
040        
041        @Override
042        public boolean isReal() {
043                return !ed.hasComplexEigenvalues();
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public double[] getEigenvalues() {
048                return eVals;
049        }
050
051        @Override
052        public double getEigenvalue(int k) {
053                return eVals[k];
054        }
055
056        @Override
057        public double[] getEigenvector(int k) {
058                return ed.getEigenvector(permutation[k]).toArray();
059        }
060        
061        // -----------------------------------------------------
062        
063        /**
064         * Sorts eigenvalues by magnitude (in descending order, including complex eigenvalues),
065         * inserts sorted values into {@link #eVals} (NaN for complex eigenvalues),
066         * and returns the associated permutation array.
067         * @param re real parts of all eigenvalues
068         * @param im imaginary parts of all eigenvalues
069         * @return the permutation array for sorting by magnitude
070         */
071        private int[] sortEigenvalues(double[] re, double[] im) {
072                final int n = re.length;
073                double[] mag = new double[n];
074                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
075                        mag[k] = Math.sqrt(sqr(re[k]) + sqr(im[k]));
076                }
077                
078                // inspired by https://stackoverflow.com/a/11998394
079                List<Integer> indices = new ArrayList<>(mag.length);
080                for (int i = 0; i < mag.length; i++) {
081                        indices.add(i);
082                }
083                
084                Comparator<Integer> comparator = new Comparator<Integer>() {
085                        @Override
086                        public int compare(Integer a, Integer b) {
087                                return Double.compare(mag[b], mag[a]);
088                        }
089                };
090
091                Collections.sort(indices, comparator);
092                int[] perm = indices.stream().mapToInt(Integer::intValue).toArray();
093                
094                // Rearrange 'eVals' and replace complex eigenvalues by NaN:
095                for (int k = 0; k < n; k++) {
096                        int j = perm[k];
097                        eVals[k] = (Arithmetic.isZero(im[j])) ? re[j] : Double.NaN;
098                }
099                return perm;
100        }
101        
102
103        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
104        private void print() {
105                System.out.println("hasComplexEigenvalues = " + ed.hasComplexEigenvalues());
106                double[] evalsR = ed.getRealEigenvalues();
107                double[] evalsI = ed.getImagEigenvalues();
108                System.out.format("evalsR = %s\n", Arrays.toString(evalsR));
109                System.out.format("evalsI = %s\n", Arrays.toString(evalsI));
110                
111                for (int k = 0; k < evalsR.length; k++) {
112                        double[] evecR = ed.getEigenvector(k).toArray();
113                        System.out.format("%d: eval=%f | evec=%s\n", k, getEigenvalue(k), Arrays.toString(getEigenvector(k)));
114                }
115        }
116
117        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
118

149}
